result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla A Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Kayla A
defendant.address: 12301 West Oklahoma Avenue #18, West Allis, WI 53227

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kayla A Johnson in court.  Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court for Kayla A Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter adjourned for Final Review Hearing by Zoom, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kayla A Johnson in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on August 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference on 7-7-2022. per email correspondence from defense counsel dated 6-27-2022.
He is in receipt of a Potential DPA Offer from the State. Defendant has a tad scheduled 7-12-2022 and request a dpa hearing date.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing scheduled August 1, 2022 at 11:15am
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kayla A Johnson in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed by Attorney Adams.

Adjustment Number: 22A 051394,
Payable Number: 1010382,
Receipt Number: 22RP022251,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/03/2022@1p
